decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to cheat out high-cost creatures like Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant using Allosaurus Rider and Eldritch Evolution. It also utilizes Neoform to search for key combo pieces and generate card advantage with Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Generous Ent. With access to Pact of Negation for protection and Consign to Memory for removal, this deck aims to create overwhelming board presence and finish the game in a single turn using powerful combos like Hedge Maze and Xenagos, God of Revels.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with creatures and burn spells. The key strategy revolves around efficiently utilizing creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to deal damage while using cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge to control the board. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to provide additional value and threats. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving the deck a strategic advantage. Overall, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on aggressively utilizing cheap and efficient spells to control the board and quickly deal damage to the opponent. Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury are key creatures that can quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support and protection for your creatures. Teferi, Time Raveler can disrupt your opponent's strategy, while Stubborn Denial offers counterspell protection. Territorial Kavu and Scion of Draco serve as strong beaters to close out games, while Consign to Memory offers versatile utility.

The UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through efficient removal spells and inexpensive creatures with prowess abilities. The deck aims to apply pressure early on by playing creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while also using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to finish off opponents. Mishra's Bauble is included to provide card advantage and fuel prowess triggers. The deck utilizes a low land count and cheap cantrips like Preordain to keep the pressure on the opponent and maintain a fast tempo throughout the game.

The deck focuses on using ramp cards like Talisman of Impulse and Utopia Sprawl to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also includes control cards like Kozilek's Command and Unholy Heat to deal with threats from the opponent. The deck aims to control the board early game and overwhelm the opponent with high-powered Eldrazi threats in the late game. The combination of powerful Eldrazi creatures and control elements makes this deck a formidable opponent in 1 vs 1 Modern matches.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies by combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. It aims to control the game through tempo plays and removal, while also using creatures with powerful abilities like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to gain incremental advantages. The deck also utilizes a mix of lands to fix mana and play powerful spells, while also taking advantage of graveyard synergies with cards like Solitude. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting opponents' game plan to come out ahead in one-on-one matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and casting spells to storm off and deal a large amount of damage in a single turn. Using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose to generate mana, Ral, Monsoon Mage to draw cards and deal damage, and Past in Flames to bring back spells from the graveyard, the deck aims to chain together a series of spells to overwhelm the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot or other finisher. The deck is built around maximizing efficiency and speed to execute the combo as quickly as possible.

The deck revolves around assembling a toolbox of versatile creatures through the use of Green Sun's Zenith and Malevolent Rumble to search for specific answers to different situations. Delighted Halfling and Dredger's Insight provide card advantage and graveyard manipulation, while Yawgmoth, Thran Physician acts as a powerful engine for sacrificing creatures and drawing cards. Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Walking Ballista offer ways to control the board and generate value. The deck focuses on leveraging the synergy between its creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure victory through a combination of combo pieces and efficient threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing mill cards to quickly deplete the opponent's library, while also having control elements to disrupt their game plan. The key strategy is to consistently mill cards from the opponent's library using cards like Archive Trap, Hedron Crab, and Ruin Crab, while also disrupting their hand and board state with cards like Drown in the Loch, Fatal Push, and Tasha's Hideous Laughter. The deck aims to quickly mill the opponent out before they can assemble their own win condition, making it a powerful combo deck in Modern.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy artifacts and overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures while utilizing powerful artifact synergies. This deck aims to control the board with cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke, while generating card advantage with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast. Urza's Saga is a key card that can provide additional artifact threats. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Salvage Titan provide recursion and value from sacrificed artifacts. Overall, this deck focuses on assembling a board presence quickly and efficiently to pressure the opponent.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly in order to storm off and cast a massive Grapeshot to take out the opponent in one turn. The key cards allow for additional mana generation, card draw, and protection, while also utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage to help dig through the deck and find the necessary pieces to execute the combo. The deck aims to efficiently chain spells together to build towards a lethal Grapeshot finish, while also using Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard for additional storm potential.

The focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently assemble the combo pieces needed to generate a large amount of card advantage and mana through abilities like Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Springleaf Drum. This allows the deck to set up explosive turns where it can dig deep into its deck with cards like Accumulate Wisdom and Song of Creation to find the necessary cards to win the game. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and other disruptive elements provides some protection and interaction against opposing strategies.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while also utilizing tokens and sacrificing effects for additional damage. By combining creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd with powerful spells like Consign to Memory and Goblin Bombardment, this deck aims to apply pressure early and close out games quickly. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional support and synergy with the deck's strategy, while versatile cards like Prismatic Ending and Solitude offer removal options against opposing threats.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Blood Moon and Thraben Charm, while generating card advantage with Seasoned Pyromancer. Additionally, Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide powerful finishers to close out games. The mana base is optimized for consistency and efficiency.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through a combination of removal spells and disruptive creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones. The deck utilizes cards like Fatal Push and Solitude to deal with threats efficiently, while cards like Flickerwisp and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional disruption. By combining aggro elements with disruptive elements, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent.

The strategy of this deck revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Mine, and Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast high impact spells and creatures such as Karn, the Great Creator, Thought-Knot Seer, and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust to control the board. The creatures in the deck, like Glaring Fleshraker and Devourer of Destiny, help to apply pressure and win the game.
